newsitem.title: UNITED NATIONS: Castro not attending U.N. session on environment.
newsitem.headline: Castro not attending U.N. session on environment.

text.p: Cuban President Fidel Castro will not be attending next week's special U.N. General Assembly session on the environment, a Cuban source said on Thursday.
Castro had been widely expected to address the session, to be attended by a large number of heads of state and government, and had been tentatively listed to speak next Tuesday.

But the source said this had never been officially confirmed and a decision on who would head the Cuban delegation was made only this week. Cuba will be represented by the president of its parliament, Ricardo Alarcon.
Alarcon, a former foreign minister, also served for some years as Cuba's U.N. representative.
In Havana, there had been no official word on whether Castro would go to the meeting. The Cuban government never comments in advance on Castro's travel plans.
